Name: Your Name (Kimi no Na wa)
Description: A breathtaking story of two strangers connected by a mysterious phenomenon.

Director.Name: Makoto Shinkai
Director.Bio: Renowned for stunning visuals and emotional stories

Name: Princess Mononoke
Description: The struggle between industrialization and nature, featuring a young warrior and forest spirits.

Name: Grave of the Fireflies
Description: A heartbreaking tale of two siblings trying to survive in war-torn Japan.

Director.Name: Isao Takahata
Director.Bio: Co-founder of Studio Ghibli, director, and producer

Name: The Garden of Words (Kotonoha no Niwa)
Description: A unique connection forms between a high school student and a mysterious woman in a garden.

Director.Name: Makoto Shinkai
Director.Bio: Renowned for stunning visuals and emotional stories

Name: Howl's Moving Castle
Description: A young woman cursed into an old body encounters a magical moving castle and its eccentric owner.

Name: A Silent Voice (Koe no Katachi)
Description: A powerful story of redemption and forgiveness involving a former bully and a deaf girl.

Director.Name: Naoko Yamada
Director.Bio: Director known for emotional dramas and character studies

Name: Whisper of the Heart (Mimi wo Sumaseba)
Description: A coming-of-age story about a young girl pursuing her dreams of becoming a writer.

Director.Name: Yoshifumi Kondō
Director.Bio: Director and key figure at Studio Ghibli

Name: Kiki's Delivery Service (Majo no Takkyūbin)
Description: A young witch sets up a delivery service in a new town and discovers her independence.

Name: Wolf Children (Ōkami Kodomo no Ame to Yuki)
Description: A touching story of a woman raising two children who can transform into wolves.

Director.Name: Mamoru Hosoda
Director.Bio: Director with a focus on family and coming-of-age

Name: Mary and the Witch's Flower (Meari to Majo no Hana)
Description: A young girl discovers a magical flower that grants her temporary magical powers.

Director.Name: Hiromasa Yonebayashi
Director.Bio: Director and animator, co-founder of Studio Ponoc

Name: The Cat Returns (Neko no Ongaeshi)
Description: A charming story about a girl who saves a cat and gets entangled in the affairs of the Cat Kingdom.

Director.Name: Hiroyuki Morita
Director.Bio: Animator and director, known for "The Cat Returns"

Name: My Neighbor Totoro
Description: Two young sisters encounter magical creatures in the countryside.

Name: Spirited Away
Description: A young girl navigates a mysterious and magical world to rescue her parents.

Name: Tales from Earthsea
Description: A young wizard embarks on a journey to discover his true self in a troubled world.

Director.Name: Goro Miyazaki
Director.Bio: Japanese film director, landscaper, and former construction consultant.

Name: Castle in the Sky
Description: A boy and a girl search for a legendary floating castle in the sky.

Name: Children Who Chase Lost Voices
Description: A girl stumbles upon a magical crystal radio connecting her to the mystical land of Agartha. Drawn by curiosity, she embarks on a captivating journey, encountering strange creatures and unraveling ancient secrets. The story explores themes of courage, loss, and the profound connection between two worlds.

Director.Name: Makoto Shinkai
Director.Bio: Renowned for stunning visuals and emotional stories
